analysis.raw_content:
Here's the extracted information from the image, maintaining absolute precision and avoiding any deductions:

**Title:** Recessed porches on the 1st floor

**Rule/Regulation:**
Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:
*   Depth of porch is less than 10' and,
*   Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor and,
*   Exterior side is substantially open.

**Figure Title:** Fig 9 Recessed porches on the 1st floor

**Note:**
It is the city's policy to consider one-story construction to be construction less than 17' above finished floor. If the porch space is higher, the area will count again as 2nd story equivalency.

**Example A Description:**
This example complies with all three critera and does NOT count toward gross floor area.

**Example A Visual Information:**
*   "2nd floor line" indicated.
*   "Porch ceiling below 2nd floor" indicated.
*   "Depth < 10'" indicated.

**Example B Description:**
This example violates two of the three critera.
*   the porch depth is greater than 10' and
*   the porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Therefore it DOES count toward gross floos area and it it is higher than 17' it will count twice (see note).

**Example B Visual Information:**
*   "2nd floor line" indicated.
*   "Height extends past 2nd floor line" indicated.
*   "Depth ≥ 10'" indicated.

**Page Number:** 14
